20#include "includes.h"
21__RCSID("$NetBSD: utf8.c,v 1.8 2019/01/27 02:08:33 pgoyette Exp $");
22/*
23 * Utility functions for multibyte-character handling,
24 * in particular to sanitize untrusted strings for terminal output.
25 */
26
27#include <sys/types.h>
28#include <langinfo.h>
29#include <limits.h>
30#include <stdarg.h>
31#include <stdio.h>
32#include <stdlib.h>
33#include <string.h>
34#include <vis.h>
35#include <wchar.h>
36
37#include "utf8.h"
38
39static int dangerous_locale(void);
40static int grow_dst(char **, size_t *, size_t, char **, size_t);
41static int vasnmprintf(char **, size_t, int *, const char *, va_list)
42 __attribute__((format(printf, 4, 0)));
43
44
45/*
46 * For US-ASCII and UTF-8 encodings, we can safely recover from
47 * encoding errors and from non-printable characters. For any
48 * other encodings, err to the side of caution and abort parsing:
49 * For state-dependent encodings, recovery is impossible.
50 * For arbitrary encodings, replacement of non-printable
51 * characters would be non-trivial and too fragile.
52 * The comments indicate what nl_langinfo(CODESET)
53 * returns for US-ASCII on various operating systems.
54 */
55
56static int
57dangerous_locale(void) {
58 char *loc;
59
60 loc = nl_langinfo(CODESET);
61 return strcmp(loc, "UTF-8") != 0 &&
62 strcmp(loc, "US-ASCII") != 0 && /* OpenBSD */
63 strcmp(loc, "ANSI_X3.4-1968") != 0 && /* Linux */
64 strcmp(loc, "ISO8859-1") != 0 && /* AIX */
65 strcmp(loc, "646") != 0 && /* Solaris, NetBSD */
66 strcmp(loc, "") != 0; /* Solaris 6 */
67}
68
69static int
70grow_dst(char **dst, size_t *sz, size_t maxsz, char **dp, size_t need)
71{
72 char *tp;
73 size_t tsz;
74
75 if (*dp + need < *dst + *sz)
76 return 0;
77 tsz = *sz + 128;
78 if (tsz > maxsz)
79 tsz = maxsz;
80 if ((tp = recallocarray(*dst, *sz, tsz, 1)) == NULL)
81 return -1;
82 *dp = tp + (*dp - *dst);
83 *dst = tp;
84 *sz = tsz;
85 return 0;
86}
87
88/*
89 * The following two functions limit the number of bytes written,
90 * including the terminating '\0', to sz. Unless wp is NULL,
91 * they limit the number of display columns occupied to *wp.
92 * Whichever is reached first terminates the output string.
93 * To stay close to the standard interfaces, they return the number of
94 * non-NUL bytes that would have been written if both were unlimited.
95 * If wp is NULL, newline, carriage return, and tab are allowed;
96 * otherwise, the actual number of columns occupied by what was
97 * written is returned in *wp.
98 */
99
100static int
101vasnmprintf(char **str, size_t maxsz, int *wp, const char *fmt, va_list ap)
102{
103 char *src; /* Source string returned from vasprintf. */
104 char *sp; /* Pointer into src. */
105 char *dst; /* Destination string to be returned. */
106 char *dp; /* Pointer into dst. */
107 char *tp; /* Temporary pointer for dst. */
108 size_t sz; /* Number of bytes allocated for dst. */
109 wchar_t wc; /* Wide character at sp. */
110 int len; /* Number of bytes in the character at sp. */
111 int ret; /* Number of bytes needed to format src. */
112 int width; /* Display width of the character wc. */
113 int total_width, max_width, print;
114
115 src = NULL;
116 if ((ret = vasprintf(&src, fmt, ap)) <= 0)
117 goto fail;
118
119 sz = strlen(src) + 1;
120 if ((dst = malloc(sz)) == NULL) {
121 free(src);
122 ret = -1;
123 goto fail;
124 }
125
126 if (maxsz > INT_MAX)
127 maxsz = INT_MAX;
128
129 sp = src;
130 dp = dst;
131 ret = 0;
132 print = 1;
133 total_width = 0;
134 max_width = wp == NULL ? INT_MAX : *wp;
135 while (*sp != '\0') {
136 if ((len = mbtowc(&wc, sp, MB_CUR_MAX)) == -1) {
137 (void)mbtowc(NULL, NULL, MB_CUR_MAX);
138 if (dangerous_locale()) {
139 ret = -1;
140 break;
141 }
142 len = 1;
143 width = -1;
144 } else if (wp == NULL &&
145 (wc == L'\n' || wc == L'\r' || wc == L'\t')) {
146 /*
147 * Don't use width uninitialized; the actual
148 * value doesn't matter because total_width
149 * is only returned for wp != NULL.
150 */
151 width = 0;
152 } else if ((width = wcwidth(wc)) == -1 &&
153 dangerous_locale()) {
154 ret = -1;
155 break;
156 }
157
158 /* Valid, printable character. */
159
160 if (width >= 0) {
161 if (print && (dp - dst >= (int)maxsz - len ||
162 total_width > max_width - width))
163 print = 0;
164 if (print) {
165 if (grow_dst(&dst, &sz, maxsz,
166 &dp, len) == -1) {
167 ret = -1;
168 break;
169 }
170 total_width += width;
171 memcpy(dp, sp, len);
172 dp += len;
173 }
174 sp += len;
175 if (ret >= 0)
176 ret += len;
177 continue;
178 }
179
180 /* Escaping required. */
181
182 while (len > 0) {
183 if (print && (dp - dst >= (int)maxsz - 4 ||
184 total_width > max_width - 4))
185 print = 0;
186 if (print) {
187 if (grow_dst(&dst, &sz, maxsz,
188 &dp, 4) == -1) {
189 ret = -1;
190 break;
191 }
192#ifndef VIS_ALL
193#define VIS_ALL VIS_WHITE /* XXX */
194#endif
195 tp = vis(dp, *sp, VIS_OCTAL | VIS_ALL, 0);
196 width = tp - dp;
197 total_width += width;
198 dp = tp;
199 } else
200 width = 4;
201 len--;
202 sp++;
203 if (ret >= 0)
204 ret += width;
205 }
206 if (len > 0)
207 break;
208 }
209 free(src);
210 *dp = '\0';
211 *str = dst;
212 if (wp != NULL)
213 *wp = total_width;
214
215 /*
216 * If the string was truncated by the width limit but
217 * would have fit into the size limit, the only sane way
218 * to report the problem is using the return value, such
219 * that the usual idiom "if (ret < 0 || ret >= sz) error"
220 * works as expected.
221 */
222
223 if (ret < (int)maxsz && !print)
224 ret = -1;
225 return ret;
226
227fail:
228 if (wp != NULL)
229 *wp = 0;
230 if (ret == 0) {
231 *str = src;
232 return 0;
233 } else {
234 *str = NULL;
235 return -1;
236 }
237}
238
239int
240snmprintf(char *str, size_t sz, int *wp, const char *fmt, ...)
241{
242 va_list ap;
243 char *cp;
244 int ret;
245
246 va_start(ap, fmt);
247 ret = vasnmprintf(&cp, sz, wp, fmt, ap);
248 va_end(ap);
249 if (cp != NULL) {
250 (void)strlcpy(str, cp, sz);
251 free(cp);
252 } else
253 *str = '\0';
254 return ret;
255}
256
257/*
258 * To stay close to the standard interfaces, the following functions
259 * return the number of non-NUL bytes written.
260 */
261
262int
263vfmprintf(FILE *stream, const char *fmt, va_list ap)
264{
265 char *str;
266 int ret;
267
268 if ((ret = vasnmprintf(&str, INT_MAX, NULL, fmt, ap)) < 0)
269 return -1;
270 if (fputs(str, stream) == EOF)
271 ret = -1;
272 free(str);
273 return ret;
274}
275
276int
277fmprintf(FILE *stream, const char *fmt, ...)
278{
279 va_list ap;
280 int ret;
281
282 va_start(ap, fmt);
283 ret = vfmprintf(stream, fmt, ap);
284 va_end(ap);
285 return ret;
286}
287
288int
289mprintf(const char *fmt, ...)
290{
291 va_list ap;
292 int ret;
293
294 va_start(ap, fmt);
295 ret = vfmprintf(stdout, fmt, ap);
296 va_end(ap);
297 return ret;
298}
